column4: This one here is from grub-install http://pastebin.com/m68c1147c
removing the 5 has teh same error, and for the --root-directory option: do you mean to mount the ubuntu partition someplace and point to the boot folder? ex. --root-directory=/mnt/buntu/boot
um...this sounds like grub wasn't configured properly
*installed on your hard drive. what's in /mnt/buntu/boot?
boot is a symlink right? i think you can remove it
indeed a good qurestion, i think the grub error is some sort of hint though.
as far as i can tell, it means grub wasn't really installed...
installed being the boot loader itself in the MBR or installed as in the files in /boot?
well, I still have me error 12 which I come to read that it means that something happend but it doesnt know what, any ideas where to progress?
This error is returned if the device strings syntax is correct but other than that, an error occurred that isn't defined by any other error.
